page.title: 04Buildings of Charnwood
page.content: Copt Oak is the only hamlet at an early road junction and meeting place of 4 parishes.It has a church of local stone by Railton 1837,built after the Enclosure Award 1829 which gave some impetus to development in the district The oldest sites are monastic ones _ Ulverscroft Priory ruins dated 12th to 15th C Listed Grade 1 & Alderman's Haw W of Beacon Hill a 13th C site.Copt Oak farmhouse and Poulteney Farm are both of 18th C date and Listed Grade 2 These with a further handful of farm houses and their various cottages and lodges have since been "gentrified". Later houses were built after 1925 when the Bradgate Estate was sold and again after 1945 until planning policies restricted building in parts of the Charnwood Forest.The total number of houses in the area is less than 70 and prices on resale are high.
